post.body: - yeah, crazy huh? anyway, hope you have a happy Xmas, with or without slush :)
- nice tree - so bright :) Happy Xmas
- Happy Xmas to you too - enjoy Ottawa
- Happy <insert holiday of preference here> to you too :)
- Happy Isaac Newton's Birthday to you too :) can we celebrate by dropping apples on people's heads?
- damn, that sucks - hope you get better soon & enjoy the rest of your holiday :)
- thanks, Andy - you too - hope you're feeling better :)
BTW, Happy Xmas, everyone :)
Lying in bed, catching up on TED video podcasts on the iPod. Technology is awesome :)
Putting together gift bags for people. Ho ho ho...
On the road, stopping for some food. Ah, Xmas Eve at McDonald's :D
eschewed laundry in favour of napping; have about an hour to organize and throw stuff in a bag before heading up to the parental abode
wearing my pyjama pants right now; dry jeans and socks are so yesterday
oh, and to the building up the street from me: thanks so much for shovelling your driveway and not your sidewalk. jerks.
beered, fed, shopped, and home; Food Depot was a little crazy, but I've not doubt that Metro would have been much, much worse
Practically swam up the street to the Pour House. Enjoying a Smithwicks while I wait for a lamb burger.
and it's bad enough navigating unshovelled sidewalks when the temperature is below freezing; now it's all melting and mixed in with rain
pouring buckets of rain out there, thus rendering the streetscape into a soupy, slushy mess - am soaked
need to go get ingredients for Mont Blanc http://snurl.com/92szk - although this Mont Blanc looks pretty good too http://snurl.com/92t07
right - need to buy one more thing, plus miscellaneous supplies; oh, there needs to be some laundry done in there as well
